title: Great for blowing leaves off a roof
text:
I bought this quadcopter for mostly one reason: to blow leaves off our roof. I'm not as sure-footed as I used to be, and rigging safety ropes takes a lot of time. I saw a few videos of people blowing leaves with drones, so I thought I'd get one and try it out.

I didn't shop for features like stabilized gimbal camera or such. I just looked for the biggest most economical quadcopter with a decent reviewer rating. (Bigger is better for leaf blowing, I reasoned.) This is the one I chose, and it worked out great for my purpose.

No it's not nearly as effective as climbing up on the roof with a leaf blower. But it did get almost all of the leaves off, with the exception of a couple of small spots. I might just wait for those to dry out and try again later.

I made a few training flights in our backyard before actually attempting to blow the leaves. I suggest starting blowing the leaves nearest the eave first then working up the roof. That way you don't wind up with a big mountain of leaves on the edge of the roof. It's slow going. Each flight was limited by the quadcopter's battery life and only lasted about 15 minutes, and it took 4 or 5 flights to get them all. I eventually bought another battery, but I had managed to get all the leaves blown off before it arrived.

I suggest putting the propeller guards on the quadcopter for leaf blowing. It seems there's something about the way the air flows around the quadcopter when it's near a wall that makes it tend to drift toward the wall. I crunched it a couple of times but with only minor damage. It's nice the manufacturer includes a few replacement props and guards, though I didn't need them. You might want to take those guards off flying around tall trees, because they'd easily hang on a branch.

I didn't use the onboard camera through a device while blowing leaves. I just watched the quadcopter directly. And I kept it oriented with the front facing away from me while flying so direction control was intuitive.

So anyway, it worked as a roof leaf blower.

title: Ease for anyone to learn
text: This drone works great and is easy for beginners.  My 14 year old learned to maneuver the drone easily right out of the box.

title: Great!
text: My son loves this drone! It is easy to control and takes great pictures! Very happy with this purchase!

title: A Holy Stone Masterpiece!
text: [[VIDEOID:3c39acadb44f7af0c1ae7316aabdb717]] A Holy Stone Masterpiece! I was excited to receive this bird as I own multiple drones from Holy Stone. The new HS100 is the best one yet. It is their first GPS drone and it does not dissappoint. From the premium packaging, the easy and minimal assembly and clear instructions, I had her in the air as soon as the batteries were charged. The main battery is very similar in design to the Phantom battery. It is very high quality with a USB charging plug. I wish there were two batteries included, however a coupon was included inside for a free extra battery. Get this as it will double the fun. This is the first controller I have with also a USB rechargeable battery battery. The downloadable app installed on my iPhone with no issues and quickly and easily connected to the drone. No issues at all. After the batteries were fully charged, I took them to the park and an was in the air in less than two minutes. The GPS found the satellites quickly and the calibrations were very easy. I started off in the default beginner mode which kept her close enough to let me figure out the flight controllers. Within two minutes I switched off the beginner mode and the fun started. The camera and video are OK at 720 though there are better 1080 camera drones out there in this price range if that is what you are looking for. The flight times are very good with the supplied battery as I got around 12 minutes of flight time. As an overall package, this is a very high quality, solid built, stable and beautiful looking drone that is easy and fun to fly. Highly recommended for both the beginner and advanced pilot.

title: Excellent customer service
text: Very nice drone. Love the RTH feature which bring the drone right back to where it took off.  Love the single button take off and land.  Comes with extra spare parts if need.

title: Fantastic drone
text: I loved learning with this drone.  I did a review previously with a little video I guess amazon lost it.  This is very easy to use, the camera is ok.  The drone is pretty tough...it took some knocks but it just kept at it.  I am a believer of Holy Stone for value, quality and the customer service is by far better than most companies!

title: Holy Stone HS100 Drone
text: We won this drone at a golf tournament and my husband and I were extremely excited to try it out. Even though we are new to drones, we followed the instructions and made our 1st flight yesterday. It was awesome!  There are a lot of cool features - Return to home, following you, GPS, seeing the clear images on your smartphone, among many others.

title: Garbage with poor support
text:
I received this drone as a gift in December 2021. The first few attempts were chaotic, but after multiple tries I was able to connect to the drone, calibrate, and fly around my home. I used the drone about 10 more times between then and now, June 2022.

After resetting the drone and recalibrating, replacing the software, rebooting my phone, and looking high and low for support, I own a poorly stabilized quadcopter that cannot sustain a signal to the app. The app crashes after being connected to the drone for more than 5 seconds. Tech support is no help, either written or phone, and there is no reasonable warranty to speak of.

Trust me - move along. There are better options out there.

title: Recommend / Awesome Drone.
text: Great drone for beginners and more experienced operators. The only thing is I'm having trouble syncing up with my internet to change initial settings. It handles great and easy to fly. Holds altitude perfectly making videos much better.

title: Great drone with lots of features for the price
text: I purchased this for my husband as a Christmas gift.  I knew he always wanted a drone but would never shell out the money for one.  I wanted a drone that was easy to fly with a good camera and that wouldn't get lost.  This unit achieved my needs and then some.  The drone flies almost by itself, takes excellent pictures, and returns home at the press of a button.  And this thing can go high!!! My husband loves it.  The only recommendation I have is to make sure you purchase extra batteries as the unit comes with only one and takes hours to charge.  Other than that no complaints.

title: One Star
text: Couldn't put the blades on. Very diffacult to  assemble. Sent it back

title: Good begginer drone.
text:
I have flown this drone in rough terrain and poor GPS signal and
my low skills. Needless to say has had some hard landings even on pavement without any apparent damage. The video is sharp clear. All and all is a very good buy for a beginner.
The con is: The app is horrible; allows very little interaction, the video gallery list is dark, very hard to see; it will take sometime to find your way with the lack of guidance on the app and the very confusing and skimpy instruction manual badly translated into English.
IF you have patience and are willing to bump your head around a little while this is the begginer drone for you.
Good harware; awful instructions and unfriendly app.

title: Just another Chinese rebrand piece of junk
text: As you can see from the photos, Mine is branded as a Promark. These are Chinese garbage. Mine came from Walmart 3 years ago for $170. It flew twice. After that it refused to connect to the control unit and refused to charge. In the two flights I took, it did not crash and only flew for about 5 minutes before signalling low power. Save your money and spend it on a better drone. Do some research by doing an internet search by image and you'll find this particular unit for sale under several brands. The same can be said for any of the drones sold by Holy Stone.

text:

title: MOTOR PROTECTION?
text: On my third flight, the drone would no longer take off, with a message of "motor protection"? Hard to believe a motor blew after two flights.  The drone sat for several months before I could fly it, so  I don't think it is still under any warranty. I  dismantled it and checked the engine, to find it runs fine with the correct voltage applied, but the drone will still not fly. This was after I had to fix a "compass calibration" problem that kept it from flying initially. Hard to give even  one star, would rather give no stars, as this thing has been nothing but a source of irritation for as long as I've had it. Never getting anything with HOLYSTONE written on it again.

title: Best Drone Ever
text: Best drone that I've had the pleasure to work with. The setup was easy and took about 20 mins to get it going. Clear instructions and the battery that came with it was also fully charged. It's very stable in flight and easy to control. I think it looks slick.

text: This drone is awesome. It is very easy to fly for beginners. It is really heavy so it can handle the wind pretty well. I got about 14 minutes out of 1 charge on the battery. The gps return to home feature works great. All in all, a pleasure to fly.

title: Nothing good to say about Holy Stone
text:
I spent over $800 trying to save money, by buying a Holy Stone GPS FPV RC Drone HS100 for $182.27 plus $123.45 for two 15 min. batteries. $15.99 for needed spare parts, and the required FAA license. All told just over $400.
The HS 100 a big bulky clumsy unresponsive drone. Complex to set up, requires the hokey pokey pre fight to set up. Calibrated? If not repeat. Maybe 10 minute flight time if all goes well. Repeat the process for each battery change. Despite its size it‚Äôs unstable in mild wind, prone to lose the signal, sluggish response to the controller. After using it less than 10 times the controller died. Holy Stone‚Äôs best offer was to ‚ÄúAllow‚Äù me to buy a replacement Drone at full price.

For a few dollars more, I opted for the Mavic Mini 2, with every thing included, 2 spare batteries, charger, case, spare parts. Nothing extra needed.
Small enough to take anywhere with ease. No FAA License required. No big bulky case to lug around. The actual performance difference is nothing short of astonishing.

Mavic Mini 2‚Äôs Beautiful 4K camera that‚Äôs packed with features found in a high end DSL cameras VS HS100‚Äôs featureless 2K camera. It‚Äôs small enough to add to my EDC camera bag. With the added option of being able to use my iPad or a tablet instead of a phone.

The Mini 2‚Äôs
1. Gimble is responsive & stable, no HS jitters.
2. Smooth, responsive, precise flight controls
3. No Hokey Pokey required, just turn the Mavic Mini 2 on and fly. With 24-30 min actual flight time per battery, versus HS 100‚Äôs 10 -15 min flight time.
4. The Mini 2 has over 10X the range of 6.2 miles over HS 100‚Äôs meager 1,000 feet. Honestly I never trusted the HS 100 more than 300 ft.
5. If HS100 went down out of sight was gone for good.
6. At 6.2 miles distances the Mavic Mini 2 low battery auto return/ land function, along with the GPS locate, with maps, light and sound alarm when you are close, is an reassuring feature.
7. What stands out is what started all this, Customer Service. You call DJI/Mavic you get a prompt polite rep. excited about helping you out. Their website has a multitude of downloadable PDF instructions, and videos. There are literally hundreds of YouTube videos.

Of course you can do what I did. Buy the cheap HS-100 drone. Pay an additional $300 plus bit by bit for the necessary extras. When you want to fly more than 10- 15 minutes at a time. Then when you get frustrated with the mediocre performance, poor picture/video quality and even worst customer service. You can move up to what is universally praised as the best beginner drone made. With high end professional features later on, for essentially the same price as the HS100, when including necessary additions. Or buy once, cry once.

A final note while both DJI (Mavic) and Holy Stone are Chinese company‚Äôs. All Mavic Drones are made in Cerritos, California providing Americans jobs. While Holy Stone‚Äôs Chinese drone are made in China. IMHO, big plus for the MAVIC MINI 2

title: This Drone handles PRETTY STRONG WINDS, even on gusty North Sea coast cliffs.
text:
This Holystone 100 is so well made & remarkably sturdy for a mid-priced drone. We just came over to our cliff-side North Sea home, from the USA where I first learned to fly very basic drones. The winds near the cliffs, on a good day here, range from 15-30mph gusts (25-48 Km/hr). Wouldn't dare try flying any drone on a bad day; the gusts sometimes make it impossible just to stand-up!
So I haven't flown far over the North Sea cliffs yet, but plan to as soon as we get a pretty calm day. I'll post the videos when I do. Even flying around the house here, this drone has taken some strong 15-20mph winds & really held its own! I'm no expert, but have been practicing for a year over the bays, behind our place on the New Jersey coast. This drone surprised me how well, I could control, take-off (has auto take-off speed) & direction, even with 15mph winds.
Haven't tried it yet with the camera, since my first goal is to become proficient flying over the North Sea cliff sides. But when I do, capturing the Puffins, Grey Seals & occasional whales on video, will be amazing. So happy my husband bought this drone last year for Christmas. Can't wait to fly it, a few yards over the North Sea cliffs & over rocks below.
After learning to fly two lesser quality drones, this HOLYSTONE 100, is like driving a 750 Porche Turbo, compared to a 4 cylinder VW Bettle. I am really impressed. Glad my husband did his homework & got this Holystone 100 drone.

title: What a great flying drone !!!  LOVE IT !!
text: I am really pleased with this Drone purchase !!!  After reading all the positive feedback I was hopeful that it would function well.. and it does.  After having 4 helicopters of varying sizes and one small quad-copter (all of which were "squirrely" in flight) this so far is amazing!!  The powerful motors, long lasting batteries, and stable flight are outstanding !!!  After 2 sessions of flying it at a local park (staying away from trees and water)  I feel I am in complete control and confident.  It is easy to fly, stable, sturdy and has lots of features that keep it that way.  The camera is steady and clear, and I love the wifi connect to my iphone, so you can see what the camera sees. It really flies well and performs beyond my expectations.  I would highly recommend it - and what a great buy.  Keep watching Amazon - they have specials now and then !!  I would also suggest a few extra batteries.  Also customer service is great - they respond quickly and answer all questions !!

title: Great drone! Easy to setup and fly
text:
This was my first larger drone. Pretty simple to set up right out of the box. The directions were easy to follow and I was flying in no time. Be sure you are outside with plenty of room. I activated the auto-takeoff on my dining room table. I would suggest getting a couple extra batteries to ensure plenty of flying time. When the battery has went dead the 2 times I have flown it, I wished I had more.

Update review 5/8/18
It has been a great experience thus far. I received the HS100 as a bday gift. I consider myself a somewhat experienced user and this one was the easiest drone to fly yet. As promised, an initial product review on amazon got me a new battery! Auto takeoff and landing make it nearly fool proof. Video quality is great for 720. The VR experience makes flying the drone even easier. Due to the video transmission to the phone not always being 100%, I felt blind for brief moments and cannot risk damage or injury during those blind spots. Customer service is amazing. Shortly after I began flying the drone, i inadvertently crashed it into my deck. Before I was able to shut it down, one of the propellers hit against a vertical support of my deck, broke, and continued to try to rotate. Unfortunately this mishap caused a plastic propeller drive gear to get stripped out. I was unable to find a schematic of the assembly to attempt to troubleshoot the issue, so i disassembled the unit. I watched the brief video on replacing a motor and assumed this would be similar. Even with the piece in hand I wasn‚Äôt able to identity what I needed to order to repair it. I sent an email and message through Facebook messenger. I was greeted with an automated message advising a representative would be with me within 24 hours. Andy replied within 2 hours of my request. With only 1 question and he identified the part and arranged a couple new gears to be sent my way. Within a couple days i got the part and was flying again.

Updated user experience.
Last night had had the drone out for a usual Monday evening flight. I have gotten more courageous in my flying endeavors and have turned up the speed for quicker response. A small wind gust caused me to over correct and and fly it into a tree. The drone immediately shut itself down when it hit the tree. The worst part was that it fell out of the tree, roughly 10 feet into some shallow water. The drone was still lit up when I retrieved it. I immediately powered off the drone and brought it home to inspect for damage. The camera had came off and was floating in the water. I discovered a small crack in the plastic housing, the rotating bracket that held the camera was hyperextended nearly out of it original placement. With some force I was able to get it back into place. I then started the tedious process of dismantling the drone to remove all aspects of water. I removed the propellers, landing gear, propeller guards, motor guards, and all of the body screws to open the body. I used compressed air to forced the residual water out of every crack, crevice, and underneath all of the boards. I then left the drone open to air for a little over 24 hours.
The battery that was in the drone at the time of the crash was exposed to water, so I put it in some rice to hopefully absorb any moisture that could have entered the battery. Once I was confident the drone had dried fully, I begun the process of reassembling it. I used the styrofoam packaging in the box for support as I put it back together. Before I completed full reassembly, powered up the drone to verify functionality. I didn‚Äôt reattach the blade guards or the lower motor covers in case i had to take it back apart. As suspected, the camera was damaged from the fall but did not have water inside the lens. Due to the impact manual rotation via the controller is no longer an option. The camera tries to rotate, but clearly audible noises are heard as it tries to move. Video still transmits clearly from the unit and flying appears to be normal. I was a little nervous to fly after the crash, I performed some general maneuvers, landed and took off and flew up to 150‚Äô altitude with no issues. Hoping this crash only paralyzed the camera. I can live with that!

Happy flying!

title: Good quality, good customer service. Beginner friendly
text:
Easy to get started and fly. Controls are sensitive, so be careful. Don‚Äôt fly on days even slightly breezy days or you‚Äôll crash.
Picture quality is outstanding. Flight time per battery lasted about 10-12 minutes, so buy extra. Helpful customer service

title: First impression review I will update in one week. Don‚Äôt buy this for beginners ScharkSpark instead!
text: So far after going through a tricky process dealing with microscopic size screws I needed a magnifying glass to use to screw the locking ring onto the motor shaft. Now I know what collapsible units are better. This is NOT a beginner unit unless you live on a large flat farm with excellent GPS signal. I live in a suburb of Central Florida and we SHOULD HAVE perfect GPS signals. Each time you turn it on, you need to pair it, then go through this three step process of holding the unit while turning in circles while holding the drone in order to set the gimbles. Why? Don‚Äôt know what I think it‚Äôs stupid to do more than once unless you‚Äôre in a different location. Then I had to go outside to finally get the unit to find a weak GPS signal. The GPS feature is why I bought this unit! Then after all that I hit the one button take off, and it flew sideways and crashed into the side of my house. I tried a SharkSparc drone which came assembled, is much smaller, but has two cameras. Out of the box after charging it flew perfectly. It doesn‚Äôt have GPS or auto return. However the video and still photos were excellent! I‚Äôll revise this after I take more time and if it still is this frustrating, it‚Äôs going back to Amazon with a final review of both the product and the seller. For $229 there are several other brands with similar features I could have bought.  Can‚Äôt afford an DJI even moderately priced unit with same features.

title: Simple to learn to and fly.
text:
I have flown the small indoor drones for a couple of years but never got accustomed to controlling it with my iPhone. I did fly it outdoors a few times but there couldn't be any wind to maintain control.
So after reading the Amazon reviews and watching several You Tube videos I decided that this would be the drone for me. After a few practice flights in my backyard I felt very comfortable controlling the drone. I'm glad that I also purchased a spare battery to achieve more flying time. I live a block away from a large park and try to get over there almost every day. Many people stop and compliment me about my ability to fly the drone but don't know how easy it is to fly. There are many trees at one end of the park so my next challenge is to fly between and around the trees.
If you're shopping for your first drone this is a good one to start with.

title: Best customer service!
text: Got this for the husband and it‚Äôs his first.  I picked this drone because of the reviews based on what wonderful customer service they had....spot on!!!  They answer immediately on any concerns and back their product!  Very happy about my choice after looking at dozens of drones and knowing nothing about them lol!

title: I have purchased several drones over the years and for ...
text: I have  purchased several drones over the years and for the price, the Holy Stone GPS HS100 was, by far, the easiest to operate with very clear video.  The return home feature is extremely helpful.  The only minor criticism I have is that the propeller guards have to be disassembled each time I put it into storage by unscrewing three screws per blade, rather than snapping on and off. title: Great customer service
text:
Constantly shows transmitter dead on app.

Update: called customer service and hung up when I got voicemail. They actually called me right back and the person who called was able help me right then and there. Pretty impressed. The fix to my problem was pair the drone to transmitter. A step I forgot. Fingers crossed

Second update: This thing is pretty awesome. I'm almost certain at this point that everyone who has the transmitter battery problem(myself included) are just forgetting to pair the drone to transmitter before calibrating compass. This is my first ever drone and I would highly recommend it to any beginner 16 and up.

title: Economic Entry Level Drone
text:
[[VIDEOID:4214b83067c61c02307ea0e7fa15fc68]] This is a fantastic entry level drone. I have piloted tons of RC aircraft into trees over the years (including this one), and the HS100 is the easiest aircraft I've ever flown (this time avoiding the trees). I was instantly impressed with how well it maintained position even with 8-10 mph winds. The auto-launch/land is a handy function to prevent damage to the drone. The picture quality is not bad, I was able to take moving pictures from about 30 ft in the air while moving at a decent resolution. While maneuvering at fast speeds the video becomes a little choppy but that is kind of expected.

I generally impressed with this drone, but it does have its flaws. The battery charge time is 5 hrs and the flight time is 15 minutes max. This makes extra batteries a major necessity. A personal issue I have with this drone is limited portability. The propellers mount to the motors using a microscopic screw and cap. This limits my desire to take it places in fear of losing the prop screws. As of right now, I just leave the propellers on and hope I don't break a prop in transit.

There's a chance it's my phone, but I noticed the video feedback is laggy and difficult to pilot with updates every 3 seconds. Also if the feed lags it saves lagged (notice the jump in the footage skips).

Overall, Holy Stone has constructed a nice piece of tech, and I would happily recommend this drone to anyone.

title: Great for beginners
text: This is my first quadcopter and so far so good. I am still in the learning stages of how to fly it, but so far it seems like a good choice for a beginner. The camera is good but not great, but again to learn on it is a good starter. The battery charge time is a little frustrating, but not a huge concern. Overall I am very happy with this drone so far.

title: Good drone for the money!

title: Can't believe how many usable features come with this drone!!
text:
[[VIDEOID:3627657f58d83b677142a751f633d6d0]] My siblings and I bought this for our 82 year old Dad for Father's Day. He's really hard to buy for and we didn't want to do the usual gift card - go buy something for yourself thing. My sister suggested a drone since Dad was a Navy pilot back in the day. He's not very technically savvy, so we wanted something that would have some semi-autonomous features like auto-takeoff and land, return to home, gyro stabilization, etc. We were a little concerned that at under $250 this model might not have the stability and ease of operation that we were looking for. However, we ordered it, charged it and assembled it without very much fanfare. The manual does have some Chenglish that you have to overcome, but isn't too bad - I've seen much worse.
We took it to a wide open field for a test before giving it to Dad - so that we could make sure it worked properly and to "train the trainers" so that we could get him going. We first tried the auto take-off, and were amazed that - even with a slight variable breeze, the drone rose to around 5 feet and settled into a very stable hover - even with the breeze! Within 10 minutes, we were very comfortable navigating - and are all thrilled to see Dad trying out his new toy. My brother and I both said that we want one also.

title: great little drone
text: great first drone everything works as it should. Just takes a bunch of steps to get going but after that it works perfect!!

title: DO NOT BUY - HAVE PURCHASED TWO OF THESE - READ REVIEW IF YOU VALUE YOUR MONEY - WE ARE OUT $250
text:
We purchased this Holy Stone HS100 as a 2019 Christmas gift for an older, smart, coordinated, calm teen. He enjoyed it for a dozen or so runs, until in inexplicably fell straight from the sky, without prior warning. Luckily, he saw it and retrieved it, and it was within 30 days purchase, so we could return it. I debated whether or not to purchase another brand, given the fact that this model lasted just a few hours. In his excitement to use this, He had already purchased two extra batteries (at $40 each), so our returning it meant he would be out the $80. So, I re-read the glowing reviews, took the plunge, and decided to reorder the same model. By this time, the price had increased $40. I asked the company if they could price-match, since the drone had to be returned through no fault of ours. They said they could not, but that they could offer us another spare $40 battery. Ugh. Tough choice, but my son liked the model, had the two batteries, so I went ahead and repurchased. He used the second model for less than two hours total when it flew off to Neverland when the "Return to Home" function did not work. We are now out $250. [$170 purchase price + $80 two spare batteries] That adds up to $62.50 an hour and no drone to show for it. This is not calculating the cost of my time in returning the first drone, sending several emails to Holy Stone company, pouring over reviews, or scouring our neighborhood and woods for several hours hoping to find it so we could return it.
Note: Oh, and the additional battery the company was going to send, in lieu of price match, has not arrived.
Pros: Looks nice when your take it out of the box and admire it flying up, up and away.
Cons: RTH function did not work.
Cons: Battery life was not 18 minutes, hence extra batteries needed.

title: Too expensive for junk
text: Ceap drone for $150. Too late to return. Used once and it broke.

title: Four Stars
text: Love my holystone drone can't wait to go camping and taking videos

title: Great beginner drone.
text: Great beginner drone. Takes great videos and easy to learn.

title: Great Features and Value At This Price Point
text:
I‚Äôve been wanting a drone for several years just to play around with but never could really justify spending the amount of $$$ for the features and video quality I wanted. I was just window shopping through Amazon at drones when I came across the HS100. For someone that was just going to use it once in a while, the $200 price of it was my limit for what for me was essentially a toy. What caught my eye was the HD 1920 / 1080P camera. That was the minimum quality I‚Äôd be happy with.

This does require a learning curve to know what all the options available are and flying it while using those options. I HIGHLY recommend that you keep it in beginners mode and fly in a wide open area with few obstacles so that you can learn flying it comfortably without worrying about crashing it into something or getting out of your line of sight.

The flying time battery life being <15 minutes is disappointing, but otherwise it is a great drone for $200. I wish I had seen the 20% discount on an extra battery when I purchased it, I likely would have got one at the reduced price. The cost of an additional battery seems to be too expensive at regular price, so I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be getting one which ultimately means I‚Äôll end up flying it a lot less often because of the short amount of flying time in relation to how long it takes to charge the battery.

I was however immensely impressed that the box came with a full 2nd set of propellers, screws & washers, and motor drive gears. That is awesome.

Bottom line is if you‚Äôd be an occasional user and 12 to 15 minutes of flying time (with just the one battery) is ok with you, this is a great little drone. The manufacturer (Holy Stone) seems to be a good quality business that wants its customers to enjoy the product.

title: Great Drone
text: Great beginners drone. Easy to learn the ropes of quadcopter flying. Built very well. I've crashed a couple of times with no damage. It didn't come with propeller guards, which would have been nice.

title: Nice for beginners
text: Nice drone, flight time is much less than advertised. I was glad I ordered a second battery. Camera image is very clear but won‚Äôt record to the SD card. Contacted the company and had at least four different people reply and had to email the same information to each one. Tried all of their solutions and none worked. Had one representative tell me they had cameras in stock and would send a replacement. Another said maybe they had one. That‚Äôs been over a month and haven‚Äôt heard anything and get no response. Unit is worth the money, after sale customer service is lacking. Three stars based solely on customer service.

title: You do not have to be a techie to fly.
text:
My kids purchased this drone for my husband's Christmas present this year. I would not have believed it, as he is not tech savvy at all, but he loves it!! With the help of our son, who has a drone, he was able to catch on how to fly very quickly. We live on a farm so it has been a delight to explore the fields from up above. The flying type is about 15 minutes, so we will be getting extra batteries for the unit. His Samsung Galaxy 7 works great with the controller.
Great fun!

title: flys great
text: fly's great and follows well.  customer service is top notch

title: Be persistent with the customer service if you have a problem.
text: This was my first drone and I am happy with it...finally. I had never flown a drone before and this was relatively simple. I bought this particular drone because the price was right and it had a Return Home feature. The problem I encountered was that the transmitter would not hold a charge for very long. It was difficult to get Holy Stone to send a replacement, but they finally did. Customer service would reply quickly to my emails, however I never had the same representative twice, so each time I would have to explain my problem. Plus I had to send them multiple videos of my problem. But I stuck with it and Holy Stone did send me a replacement transmitter. I appreciated that I didn't have to box anything up to return back to them.

title: Even a Grandpa Can Fly It
text: I am a retired senior, and never have flown a drone or other RC aircraft.  I am barely literate in all things computer or iPhone related.  With the help of my more techno savy wife, and by looking at You Tube and reading the instruction manual, my first flight went off without a hitch.  Flies itself.  Set control speed to slow, and left default settings for height and distance to the beginner distances of 30 meters.  Will use around my small western ranch. Ordered extra batteries.

title: Timely
text: I purchased this for a Christmas gift. It is still in the box. It was rated 4 1/2 stars by many so I think it will be awesome. Delivery on time.

title: Awesome Company
text: Company is amazing. If you are looking for a drone I recommend Holy Stone.

title: Look elsewhere
text: The drone does not connect to GPS well and it flies erratically at times.

title: Size + Sophistication + Patience = New-found FUN!!!
text:
I ordered my HS100 on a Wednesday and it delivered three business days later. Excellent delivery service. The packaging was typical Holy Stone excellence. All parts were in the box and perfectly wrapped & secured. (It did take a minute to locate the included two sets of props - they are in a recess on the bottom of the styrofoam parts carrier).

I studied the Users Manual for an evening and read the Holy Stone user groups comments on the HS100 before taking flight for the first time. This was time very well spent. I have a friend who is a professional drone pilot photographer and got a little one-on-one coaching from him. INFORMATION BEFORE YOU FLY is important for any aircraft but especially for your first "upper end" aircraft.

I have other drones but this is by far the largest and most sophisticated drone in my hanger. It is impressive, it is strong, and it is big compared to my others. I am respecting its power, weight, and size until I get a "hands feel" for the aircraft.

The HS100 drone is powerful, especially compared to my first HS drone, the f181 (which remains my "go-to" favorite if I just want to take a few laps around the neighborhood). The '100 is smooth to fly and the auto-land works beautifully. Really have not had many initial problems other than having to wait a very long time to recharge the drone battery.

I now have six flights with my HS100 in the first five days. For these first flights I elected to not connect the WiFi system, preferring to concentrate on just bare bones flying at first. I am a long-time pilot of both real aircraft and RC aircraft. It's easier for me to first understand the "stick & rudder" traits of an unfamiliar craft before learning the "accessories" of the craft. I'm a "Basics First" type of pilot.

NOTE!!! It is critically important to go through the initial calibration steps listed in the Manual. You will NOT fly until you do these tasks. Do the steps, period! Understand why they are necessary. This is a MUST-DO and only takes a very few minutes.

I will connect WiFi today, weather permitting. I have not flown FPV on anything yet unless I was sitting in the cockpit. Looking forward to seeing what the drone sees!

The airborne battery pack takes awhile to charge but it charges smoothly...no heat, no problems other than 2-3 hours to replenish. I would definitely like an additional battery. In the HS100 box is a coupon for a second battery. I will pursue that today.

The Controller is very comfortable to hold and recharges relatively quickly. A future option might be the ability to replace the rechargeable LiPo's in the controller with AA-cells so you could be back in the air in a couple of minutes but this would actually predicate on having an extra Drone battery already charged and at the ready.

These are my initial thoughts and first report. After I have a few flights with the WiFi system I will file an updated report. So far, so good. "Patience" is the keyword for me now. Who says you can't teach a 70-year-old real pilot and radio-control airplane pilot how to fly a drone?

My initial rating is Five Stars, based on Four Stars for the drone out of the box but with a bonus Fifth Star for the splendid Customer Service folks at Holy Stone. There are a couple of bugs that I expect will be worked out with future software updates but I would indeed expect fine-tuning to occur on a brand new model as it moves forward. I cannot fairly ding them for those initial little bugs as long as they continue to work them out. I think Holy Stone definitely has a potential winner here.

HAPPY and SAFE FLYING!

title: Holy Stone!!! More like Holy Moly!
text: Thank you so much Zare Zhan! For your wonderful customer service. Holy Stone really knows how to take care of their customers. My drone was acting up and they freely sent another, one no questions ask. A loyal customers right here indeed. Definitely referring others to invest ;-)

title: This is a nice Drone - long review and suggestions.
text:
I have not flown a Drone before ‚Äì I hope ‚Äòdrone‚Äô is the right term. However, I have flown fly-bar-less full axis R/C helicopters, very aerobatic, using 6S, 4500mah batteries and I fly aerobatic airplanes, 10S batteries, almost daily. Point is, I‚Äôm not new to R/C but am new to FVP drones. As such, I never take my eyes off the plane / helicopter when flying R/C and it was very difficult to take my eyes off the drone when flying ‚Äì just a habit for me. Once I figured out the HS100 would be in the same place if I took my eyes off it, which allowed me to look at my cell phone screen, seeing what the camera ‚Äòsees‚Äô it was a whole new experience for me. Quite interesting! After the first flight I took it off the ‚Äúbeginner‚Äù mode as it was stable, but responds quickly (QUICKLY) to any stick input on the transmitter ‚Äì SO MOVE THE STICKS SLOWLY if you are an inexperienced flyer. This is one area I‚Äôd like to see improved ‚Äì the more expensive transmitters have what‚Äôs called Dual Rates, allowing you to set the response of control surfaces (how has the plane / Heli responds to stick movements) allowing for smooth flight, or 3D type flying. I think it would be a simple software modification for the future allowing a variable rate (programmed by the user) or a 50% fixed rate of the ‚Äònormal‚Äô response to stick movement. Also, when flying R/C the left stick is not centered like this one, but it was not hard to get use to, and I think a good idea for this class of Drone. Push up, the Drone ascends, pull down, the Drone descends ‚Äì simple enough.

My assembly ‚Äì straight forward but I had one screw out of 8, holding the blade guards in place where the plastic was ‚Äòstripped / too large‚Äô for the screw ‚Äì no, I did not over-tighten, it was this way, but easily fixed. The extra parts provided are a nice tough too. The binding was simple; the calibration was a bit difficult for me to understand as I have not done this before. The text on the cell phone told me just what to do, but in the 2nd stage of calibration, it was unclear to me if I was to hold the Drone upside down, or at right angles to the ground. Perhaps changing the wording to ‚Äúpoint the camera at the ground and rotate your body in a circle‚Äù would be easier to understand? YouTube cleared this up.

I was a bit paranoid about the power up sequence, unsure when the Drone is actually Armed and ready to fly ‚Äì but the screen on the cell phone tells you this ‚Äì which is great ‚Äì and I‚Äôll assume the power to the motors are disabled until the screen tells you the Drone is ‚Äúready to fly‚Äù. On my other RC models I have an ‚Äúarming plug‚Äù and once this is plugged it, I know the plane is ready to go! I am so use to this arming plug it was uncomfortable for me to power on the Tx and drone and then start moving the sticks ‚Äì for instance in Binding ‚Äì move the left stick forward and backwards to start the binding sequence. Scary for me as the drone and Tx have power at that time ‚Äì but not to worry, no issues, all worked fine. I never had the drone ‚Äòactive‚Äô with blades turning when I was not ready.

Having flown R/C with LiPo batteries for 15+ years, I would like to stress this is nothing to play around with. It can be very dangerous ‚Äì and cause fires. READ THE YELLOW CAUTIONS PAPER that comes with the HS100. I read about one person who states the batteries caught fire ‚Äì but I‚Äôm pretty sure this person left the USB charger (you provide ‚Äì not included in the package) on at 2A, or was charging over 2A (WHICH YOU ARE TOLD NOT TO DO!!!!)‚Ä¶ the caution specifically states NOT TO KEEP THE BATTERIES CHARGING ‚Äì and you MUST MONITOR THIS. Yes, you will forget at some point, and you may be lucky, but if the USB charger keeps charging when the cells are charged, overcharging might occur. This is my next area of recommendation for Holy Stone ‚Äì spend a little more money have provide a charger that monitors and charges the batteries the 7.4V pack (2 cells), then shuts OFF. WE KNOW PEOPLE WILL FORGET, WE KNOW THIS!! You‚Äôll note the USB is 5V and there is no way to charge 2 cells (at the same time) to 7.4V battery from a 5V source. So, the charger must charge one cell at a time and when the 1st cell is charged to some predetermined level, like 4.1V (4.2 would be ideal) then some circuitry must note this and then the 2nd cell starts to charge. The question becomes, what happens when the 2nd cell is charged? What happens if the 2nd cell is only partially charged? This may cause a problem as the current will be taken from both cells and the lower cell will discharge faster than the fully charged cell. Your are specifically told ‚ÄúMake sure to remove the batteries from the charger after charging is complete‚Äù, so I‚Äôll assume the USB charger keeps pumping current into the battery ‚Äì at some reduced current, but overnight charging is NOT RECOMMENDED ‚Äì and can be dangerous!!

Like others have reported, is the black dot you see on the video when looking into the sun. Never seen this before from a camera, but this camera has this problem. While not a huge issue as any video looking toward the sun is not good quality anyway, it would be nice to remove this issue.

I am just starting to fly this drone and have not tried the ‚Äòfollow me‚Äô mode or other features, but plan to give it a good test in the coming weeks. Also, I can‚Äôt compare this model to others as I have not flown drones before, but I think for the price, it‚Äôs a decent starting point for those that want GPS. If not, a cheaper version, the HS300 does not have GPS but looks like a good started Drone also.

title: Easy to use
text: I purchased this product as a drone beginner . I have never flown a drone before but I have to say that this product is very easy to fly and is easy to learn how to control . The device has propellor guards which also help balance the drone in high winds and prevent crashes for new users. I bought this drone for photography and the camera is very crisp and clear. I like that it has a gps feature to return to you if it gets out of range and the follow me feature which hovers and follows you as you walk . Make sure you have more than one battery for maximum flying time.

title: Holy Stone GPS Drone
text: I think this is an ideal drone for a beginner or even an experienced user who is not too concerned about the image quality.  It is easy to use and takes excellent images, just not high resolution.  It is reasonably priced and I am having a great time flying it every now and then.  It is a good start for a beginner before you crash a pricier drone.  I would say the camera is average and you lose connection once you fly too high or too far but aside from that the GPS is fairly accurate and lands exactly where it took off or within a few feet.

title: Drone rookie

title: Great for many ages, easy to use.
text: I love this drone, it works great and the camera is surprisingly good. All features work as they should and I haven't had any issues with the camera, app, or controller. I would recommend this drone to everyone. It's not a drone for doing tricks or speed, however works great for filming and flight time is better then any other drone I have owned. I have only tried flying the drone 100 yards so far and was still responsive with the controller, but I did loose signal to my phone so I didn't know video quality until watching it on my computer.

title: Excellent Drone for the money.
text: Very good drone for the beginner. Parts are easy to find and easy to install. Only thing I would recommend is upgrading to the better camera. Great customer service. I would buy again

title: Nice Flying GPS Drone
text:
I was excited to see this was a GPS drone :-) I like that it has the ability to set the max distance and altitude along with the height using the App. It will return to the exact spot where it took off from when RTH is activated either automatically or when you press the home button. The snap in battery makes it so easy when it is time to install or remove it. I was able to fly out about 600ft and reached a speed between 15 and 20mph which is good when fighting a light wind. The GPS held position very well which helps when trying to video and not worry if it will drift away. The app works very well and also keeps track of your flights showing max height, speed and distance. They give you enough spare parts should you need them. I would suggest getting an extra battery so you can stay out longer when flying between charging. I will try to post some videos later so you can see the quality of the camera. Photos and Video can be started or stopped from the controller or the app. Both the controller and flight battery are rechargeable which is nice so you don't have to keep buying batteries. Also I did want to mention that the app has a selection for VR which takes the screen and turns it into 2 so if you want to place your phone into a set of VR goggles you will feel like you are inside your drone looking down. I have touched on many positive points of this drone and sure my Granddaughter is going to love it :-) If anyone has any questions please write and I will try to answer what I can. I have been flying drones and planes for many years. Wishing you the best

Hope this helped Take Care :-) GrandpaJake

title: Fun and Easy to fly, right out of the box
text:
[[VIDEOID:6bd4c54a62b81b647b09f2d7d47fabef]] I consider myself a beginner when it comes to drones. My first drone was an HS110 which I liked a lot.

I decided to try a more advanced drone, and purchased an HS100 GPS. When I opened the box, I found the drone, extra guards and props, memory card, usb reader, as well as a screwdriver, screws and washers, and directions. It even included a nice branded notepad with pen, I suppose for logging my flights.

When I followed them step by step, it appeared as if it didn‚Äôt pair correctly. Then I watched a youtube video, and learned that I needed to do a compass calibration before it would pair. No big deal.

After I got it paired, I decided to start my first flight. There was a slight breeze that day, and the first thing I noticed is how well it maintained it‚Äôs position and altitude. I have a lot of trees around my house, so I was flying conservatively. Surprisingly, it was very easy to navigate around all the obstacles especially in the light wind.

I recorded a couple flights, and was really impressed with the camera quality. I also liked the fact that I could remotely pivot the camera so it shoots directly under the drone while flying.

Overall I‚Äôm really impressed with the quality of this drone, as well as how easy it was to fly. I live in the North East, and unfortunately there‚Äôs a lot of snow and wind right now. I can‚Äôt wait for better weather to permit me to fly it in a larger, more open area to really put this to the test.

I was really impressed with Holystone‚Äôs customer service. I emailed them with a few questions, and got a quick response, and followed up afterwards to make sure things were ok.

I strongly recommend HolyStone, and this drone.

title: What a great drone
text: I'm so use to smaller drones that I could fly inside and this one is not for that. lol The auto take off is perfect lifting the drone to approx 5 ft and hovers (in GPS mode) until you make the next move, video is super clear, in gps mode the filming could get jumpy due to the gps keeping the drone in place but won't jump with the gps off. Pretty easy to get going after you do the compass dance which I must say has improved my pirouetting spins, lol. I registered my HS100 for 5 bucks & 2 years so I can't wait to take this puppy to the park.

title: Good enough to practice with
text: This product is definitely meant to learn with. The video quality is horrible and I would not think twice about creating anything with the footage. It also can‚Äôt fly very far away from you so forget about getting cool nature shots. However, if you want to practice using a drone before investing in a more expensive one then I would recommend this. It‚Äôs easy to use and holds up pretty good in the wind. We took it to the beach and it didn‚Äôt have any issues.

title: Wish I could have kept it
text: Had to return. My husband became ill during Christmas but bigger than expected!! Looked sturdy. Packed well!

title: Amazing drone for first time drone buyer
text: If your new to drones and hesitant to spend big money this is a good alternative. My daughter knew I was contemplating buying a drone but hesitant because I‚Äôm not very skilled at remote aircraft. She got me this one for my Bday after researching drones. The first flight was amazingly simple this isn‚Äôt a drone that would crash easily. It flys super stabil and very controllable. I‚Äôve tried both headless mode and regular and they both work well. First flight I used the geofence to keep it close by. Very cool that when battery is almost drained it comes back. The auto takeoff and landing is a very nice feature. The biggest setback isn‚Äôt the drone it‚Äôs the iPhone screen in the sun. That‚Äôs not HS fault for sure. The altitude pics from the 2k camera are very cool. Overall I‚Äôm very impressed and it was money well spent. It‚Äôs something I can actually enjoy because it is so easy to fly and not stressful. I want to enjoy doing something and not stress out about it. A friend who saw a Facebook post about my first flight ordered one that day! For now I can‚Äôt see spending more money on a different one because this one has enough features to keep my busy. I need to get better with the camera. Definitely recommend for getting started in the drone hobby.

I‚Äôve emailed them several times and within minutes someone is responding. They make every effort to assist you in a favorable way. I have never had any problems with dealing with Holystone.

title: Great Drone!

title: This is a lot of drone for the money, fun and easy to fly
text:
[[VIDEOID:e2ec8c1f707c1ce68fa649790539c974]] The GPS mode keeps the HS100 stable in flight and gives you some insurance it will return back to the take off point if signal is lost or the battery runs low. Release the sticks and this thing will hover where it is without any help. All the parts and spare parts were in the box and the manual is easily readable. The phone app lets you dial in max altitude and range, for a little added safety. The response speed is adjustable so you do not need lightening reflexes for control. Be sure you register it at the official FAA web site, as a recreational small UAS, it costs $5 for 3 years. There are other sites that try to look like the FAA site and want way more than $5.
I do recommend the FAA's B4UFLY phone app. This app will let you be aware of any flight restrictions in your area. Fly safe and have fun!
Note: you need to do a short calibration procedure for the compass if in a different location, it is in the manual and takes about 10 seconds. Without GPS this is not easy to fly. Read the manual and check the LEDs to be sure you have GPS reception.
The camera can support a micro SD memory card up to 32 GB with a FAT or FAT32 format. I purchased this one [[ASIN:B010Q57T02 SanDisk Ultra 32GB microSDHC UHS-I Card with Adapter, Grey/Red, Standard Packaging (SDSQUNC-032G-GN6MA)]] and it worked without any need to format it, it came as FAT32.
A spare battery or two are worth while investments. Let the HS-100 cool about 10 minutes before inserting a new battery.
I have included a short video taken between 20 and 60 feet in altitude. The winds were 5 mph gusting to 10. This is from the first time I took this up to try filming.
By the way, this will fly perfectly well without a WiFi phone connected. It can record to the internal camera memory card. I have started flying it without the phone, mainly because the WiFi cuts off (at about 120 Meters ) way before the maximum controller range (at about 500 Meters) is reached, that and the controller is just easier to hold without a phone stuck to the top. Just be sure you understand what the LED light mean with the different flashing patterns. You should not have any flashing LEDs at take off.

title: I am hooked.
text: My maiden flight was today. This is my 1st experience with a drone (64 years old), I went to a large field with plenty of room. The wind was gusting a little which did affect control, but only slightly. The video quality was OK.  The beginner distance/height presets worked well. The auto take off was a life saver since it provides a little time for learning the controls. The drone returned automatically when the battery was low. I am now hooked.

title: Great Drone for a beginner!
text: This drone is a really good drone for a beginner. It is well made and very durable. I like the guards for the propellers that are easy to install and remove per your preference. It has a beginner mode and tracks very well. I would suggest that you watch a youTube video to see how to install the propellers. It will make it easier to install them.

title: Just what the birthday "boy" called for.
text:
My husband wanted a drone for his birthday. We looked and looked and then we looked some more. Then we ran across this one. It was a good price and a good product. It's a good sized one as well. Nearly the same size as the Phantom.
It's a great drone. The camera is fairly good. The only thing we noticed is that you cannot control it unless you have a cell phone attached. We wanted to use it to take an aerial view of the inside of or building that has super high ceilings.
It wouldn't connect. We took it outside and it connected okay. I think it could have been interference from the building inside.
He has had so much fun playing with it. Very enjoyable. thank you Holy Stone for a great product. Would and do plan on purchasing another one.

title: IMPORTANT PLEASE READ!
text:
Kudos where due, their customer service is impeccable, and I'm in the biz. Bit new to drones but wanted a challenging starter, well I got that for sure, the HS100 is awesome. Even my family was saying "Are u sure you haven't done this before". Followed many instructional videos online to get up to speed, 1st couple flights (following the rules) I felt like a pro right out of the box. Then bravado took over, forgetting all that I had learned, and wham-o, hard landing and my new friend is busted up. Contacted C/S @ Holy Stone and I will say again: Nothing Short of Amazing, 6000 miles away and I get better service than I get in my own home town. Don't get me wrong the Drone is fantastic, but CS, hands down the best I've encountered, these folks really care about their company, and it shows in their products. For those who know me at Holy Stone, I thank you! I'll try to stay in the Air :) Ë∞¢Ë∞¢
Michael, Boise

title: Good drone for the money
text: Good drone for the money. Easy to set up and fly. Instructions can be a little confusing at parts, but customer service was responsive. Original battery was defective, which was disappointing, but customer service sent a free working replacement.

title: Don't buy another drone!
text: I've gotten 5 drones before this one in this price range, and had a tough time with all of them.  When I received this one, I was surprised at the ease of controls, and functionality of it! I've had several flights, and can tell you this one stand out in this price range, and is better than many that are priced way more!  I was about to give up on getting anything because I just thought I didn't have the knack for drones, but after this, I found I just didn't have any that were descent before I got this one.  Thank you so much for this! I am buying a second one, and extra batteries and accessories. I feel comfortable investing more time and money in a quality product.

title: Great drone for the price.  Stable flights.  Return to home works well.  FPV view is pretty cool.
text: I've been waiting a few years to get a drone as I wanted to wait for GPS and FPV to become more standard before purchasing.  I decided to go with the Holy Stone HS100 drone.  I must say its much easier to fly than I had anticipated.  The stability while in flight is very good I think.  Did a few photos / videos during flight and the quality came out great.  Return to home feature works well (give or take a few feet) so make sure you have a good amount of room to compensate for any variations in landing.  The battery life is as the documentation states - about 15 minutes.  I recommend picking up a 2nd or 3rd battery just to maximize your fly time.  It does take about 4 hours to fully charge the battery.  As the weather warms up I can see having fun with this during Spring/Summer.

title: Easy to use/great for beginners
text: This was well worth the money! Great handle and camera quality. I really like the return home and follow me feature. My only suggestion would be to buy an extra battery. The battery only last about 15min. Overall, good purchase.

The return to home key brings the drone back to where you took off from which is a really cool feature. Would highly recommend this drone.

title: Excellent starter for anyone
text:
Excellent starter for anyone, it is very responsive, you can keep it hovering while you tilt the camera, very satisfied!

update
It is a really good buy for the price, I will give you some useful data.
1. It goes really, really high, I am a newbie so when I fly it very high is only to test it and then I have to use the return button to make it come back.
2. The return button works better than expected, very accurate.
3. I don't think this one can fly on winds stronger than a breeze, even less if you put it 100ft high. With a gentle breeze and that distance from the ground it takes a while to return and you can see how it strugles to reach home. If you are low on battery you may lose the drone.
4. Battery wont last more than 20 minutes on a full charge, so buy an extra battery. Good thing is the company will send you a free battery if you like them in facebook.
5. You can dissassemble it almost completely, is very easy.
6. I would definitely buy again.
7. Camera is decent, not for profesional use though.

title: Holy Stone is great
text: The usefulness of the Holy Stone drone, in itself is good.  It flys easily and has good range and decent image quality.  I have not had a single issue but have had very limited opportunities to use it.  New rules and regulations for the use of drones have severely hampered the ability to fly one legally.  Be sure to check the rules prior to spending the money as you probably can not use it like you had intended to use it.

title: Very good drone but poor battery performance (only getting 10 minutes when should be 18)
text:
This is my first drone. I‚Äôve flown RC Helicopters and airplanes before. I purchased this particular model because it is larger and heavier than most and I wanted a drone that could hopefully resist the wind where I live. After reading the manual I found the drone easy to assemble (have to attach landing gear and camera), charged transmitter & drone batteries, turned on transmitter and drone, paired them, calibrated the compass (be sure to read the instructions carefully about how to do this as I got it wrong first time) and gyro, then let it find GPS satellites (can take a minute or so).
First few flights went well as I grew more comfortable and flew higher and further, though I did experience a few crashes and hard landings due to operator error/inexperience! I stayed in Beginner‚Äôs Mode to start with then set maximum distance to 100‚Äô (30m) and maximum height to 50‚Äô (15m) for now. I avoid windy days or flying where there were people, cars, buildings, trees, etc. until I feel more confident about not crashing!
I bought a 32GB TF card so I could take photos and record videos on it and transfer to my PC. Then I downloaded the app, installed it on my Android phone (Samsung Galaxy s7) and connected to drone via Wi-Fi so I could see what it was doing and record videos that way. Worked just fine. Good video quality but a bit shaky when drone is fighting wind.
After visiting some Facebook groups I learned about an app called UAV Forecast which recommends if its safe to fly based on Kp index, availability of satellites, wind, etc.
I have not yet tried RTH feature as I‚Äôm not sure I understand how it is supposed work. I want to wait until I have more open space and less wind to try it. Same with Follow Me.
Flight time is limited to about 10 minutes with the included 3500mAh battery (NOT the 15-18 minutes claimed by manufacturer unless that is for no maneuvers or fighting wind, etc.) so I‚Äôll be getting another soon*. I already bought a spare set of propellers and landing gear as use so far and a few crashes has beaten up the originals quite a bit!
Note that due to the size and weight (26oz) of this drone I had to register it with the FAA, which was quick and easy ($5 for 3 years). I live within 5 miles of a medium airport which is Class D controlled airspace so am limited to 400‚Äô altitude. I doubt I‚Äôll ever have the confidence to go that high. 100‚Äô perhaps. Also, drone flyers must get a TRUST certificate from the FAA. It is a quick and easy test.

UPDATE: I'm only getting flying time of about 10 minutes at best from this supposedly updated, intelligent 3500mAh battery that manufacturer claims should give 18 minutes of flight time. So I'm only getting just over half of that! Drone goes into low battery Return To Home mode after about 10 minutes. I always make sure it is fully charged (all four blue lights solid). I'm deducting a star for this.

title: Very tech advanced, and fun
text: My brother got me the hubsan x4 for Christmas and I loved it. I bought him this drone for his birthday in July and I would say it's amazing drone. Only "comparison" is that this one is slightly bigger, and more tech driven with the wifi app. But this means it drains battery faster than hubsan x4. Not disappointed but the battery life is way different. Hubsan x4 runs about 180 and this one about 220. If you want 20 minutes of flight time, with old fashion remote controller go with hubsan, if you want to fit in with the big boys and "look" like you have a 1500 drone, buy this holy stone. However, flight time is about 12 minutes max.  Image on your phone is super clean. Wifi is great. Man distance about 500M and the hubsan is about 800 M (difference if about 3.25 football fields.) But do you really need to go that far out? Lol buy a1500 drone for that.

title: Very impressive GPS features, but disappointing Video Quality.
text: [[VIDEOID:e7e26a04dc0919f11e4414591fda1636]] I've really wanted a video drone for a long time and finally decided to buy the Holy Stone HS100 drone on Prime Day. I felt the price point was enticing enough to give it a try. I was very surprised at the sophistication of this drone. I spent about an hour assembling it. There isn't anything cheap about it. I felt that I got my money's worth alone on the flyability of this drone. It works great with the phone app. The GPS feature is really great for having a simple one-button touch to both launch and land the drone. It's fast too. I found the maneuverability to be very responsive. My concern with the GPS is that you need a strong signal to connect your phone to the drone. I was in a large field and had to walk around a bit to find an area with a strong GPS signal. I was a bit disappointed with the quality of video from this drone. I expected the 1080P HD camera to have a lot more detail. Instead, a lot of colors just blended in together. I felt the best looking video was that of things that were far off in the distance. Another concern was that the video was recorded in a .avi format. I'm a Mac user and can't view .avi. It's a Windows-exclusive video format. Yes, there are conversion apps out there, but it's another time and monetary expense to view the files. While the video did concern me, I did have to remind myself that this is not a professional video drone. And because of that I didn't take any points off. The video I get is blotchy, but still viewable. I did call support and they were quick to answer my questions and listen to my concerns. Also, Holy Stone offers a free battery for giving an Amazon review. That's a $40 savings right there...and a nice value-added reason for buying this drone. Bottom line, it's a feature-rich drone that has some impressive GPS qualities, but the video is not true high-definition quality. I would think this best for a teen who might be a budding video enthusiast. I'll use it a lot, but I'll keep my expectations low for the quality of video. All in all it's a good choice for a starter video drone.

title: 16 Months later... still going strong!
text:
Being my 1st drone, I didn't want to spend too much. I also didn't want a tiny toy that would break a part the first day of flight.
This Holy Stone is quite the drone. It is large, yet it is nimble. The strong motors allow it to fly well on windy days, and the GPS keeps it from getting away from you.
Incredibly easy learning curve for a beginner... like myself! Just remember to recalibrate it before your flight... which takes less than a minute.
The 720p camera is clear and crisp, for about double the price I could've gotten a 1080p version; like I said I wanted to keep the price low for my 1st. drone.
This drone is quite rugged, and has survived a few hard landings without damage.
I have experienced no issues with the drone. I would recommend purchasing an extra battery pack or two so you can double or triple your flight time.

title: Buy One and Smile !

I've owned 3 other quads in the same price range but they were toys compared to this bad boy. Incredibly stable even in Oklahoma winds.

You know how you just know quality when you see and feel it ? That's Holy Stone. I'm already thinking of upgrading in the future.

If you are new quads, have no fear, this is for you. Simple instructions, extra parts and a great app. Sweet camera too. What are you waiting for ?! Btw the photo is not from the highest elevation. Will add more later.

title: Far More for my money than I expected!
text:
A very pleasant surprise in very many ways:
I have flown drones that have no GPS or stabilizing devices. They are very hard to fly. I researched better drones which had stabilizing and was ready to pay $1100 to $1500. Then I read the advertising copy for HolyStone HS100[[ASIN:B074YYVXQH Holy Stone GPS FPV RC Drone HS100 with Camera Live Video and GPS Return Home Quadcopter with Adjustable Wide-Angle 720P HD WIFI Camera- Follow Me, Altitude Hold, Intelligent Battery Long Control Range]]. AND THIS ONE WAS UNDER $300 !!!
I COULDN'T BELIEVE IT! GPS, stabilizing, auto take offs and landings, automatic return home etc. I flew it perfectly the first time I tried it!
I had a problem with charging the transmitter and I e-mailed HolyStone. Quick reply! Informative reply! Problem solved! Great service!

title: A good GPS drone!
text: What an amazing drone!  Let me just say if you are in the market for a GPS drone but don't want to pay the high cost of a DJI, get this one.  Flying this drone is quite fun.  The GPS functions do work but they are not the most precise.  The return home will make the drone come back to its original take off within 5 feet (not too bad I guess).  The follow me is similar, it does keep up with your movements though it can be a bit jerky (sudden stops).  I ran 30 feet and the drone did fairly well in keeping up with me only to have a sudden stop.  In a low wind environment, the drone can hold its position quite well.  The remote feels fairly good in your hands.  You will need to charge the remote just like with the DJI's.  When you are attaching the blades, get a magnetic screw driver as it will save you so much time and anger.  You have to screw in 4 screws to secure the blades and they are really small.  Having the phone holder in the remote is a clever idea, it does come at a cost.  If you got a larger/thicker phone, you may run into issues for mounting it.  Perhaps HolyStone can make another remote or an add on for larger/thicker phones.  The phone app is fairly easy to use but it does have some connections for video feed.  HolyStone is making updates for the app which is making it better and more stable. I love the modular battery as it makes battery installation and removal easy.  Also it charges with a micro usb cable which is very nice.  Keep up the good work HolyStone!

The one touch take off and one touch landing buttons on this drone make it virtually fail safe. The return to home features give you a sense that even if it drifts and the battery gets low you will have a successful end of flight experience. Everything works perfectly and we are very happy we made this purchase.

title: Fell out of the sky, Holy Stone Replaced!
text:
(Update)
After Holy Stone read me review, without me even asking they contacted me and offered to replace my drone. I'm so happy for the opportunity to return to flying. Holy Stone is an amazing company with exceptional customer service.

(Original)
I was so excited to get my Holy Stone HS100-2k with GPS and fly it. I've owned a few Holy Stone quadcopters in the past and had always been pleased with them. I read the instructions and set out for my first flight. I was off and flying, the drone seemed to handle well enough for the price point and the video streaming was smooth even though my cell phone (Pixel 3XL) did not fit in the remote control's phone holder.

While flying I pressed the land button on accident and attempted to accelerate up to cancel out of it. This didn't seem to work so I pressed the land button again still nothing as the drone continued to descend. So I pressed the landing button again and held it hoping that would cancel the landing. This shut off the motors completely while I was around 50 feet in the air. I watched in horror as my quad tumbled out of the sky in complete shock. Turns out after if you look on page 22 of the instructions holding the one key landing button for 2 seconds will stop the motors immediately and the drone will fall! Needless to say I was not impressed with this functionality at all and even less impressed that it was on page 22 and not in bold or red to stand out.

I glued the quad back together and attempted to fly it again the next day, GPS synced and camera still worked. Pressed the one button take off button and the motor on the arm that broke off did not turn. I attempted this a few times and manually turned the propeller, no binding everything turned freely. The motor acted like it wasn't getting power. I took the motor cover off, powered the drone on in headless mode and used a multimeter to measured for a voltage on the power wires to the motor while pressing the take off button. Nothing.

Long story short I opened the drone completely up and checked the MOSFET that is used to turn the non responsive motor on. Turns out the MOSFET's failed, the forward voltage between the gate and source according to the manufacture's datasheet should be 0.7V min, 1.2V typical, and 1.7V max. The three working MOSFETs all measured around between 1.05-1.2V with the failed one not turning on at all. If you want an exact replacement, they are FNK08N03D n-channel mosfets, they are a special order part and I should have it in 15-25 days :(

title: All the bells and whistles
text:
The HS100 has everything! HolyStone left nothing out when designing the HS100. It has a very stable GPS positioning system which allows it to remain steady even in moderate wind speeds. That same GPS system will return the drone back to its point of take off so there is no worry that it will fly away.

The smart battery features a low voltage return to home failsafe. It can be charged by any standard cell phone charging usb. You can even use a portable power bank to recharge the battery.

The controller is also a first for HolyStone and features a internal rechargeable lipo battery. No more AA batteries to purchase seperately.

The APP is very user friendly and allows for live distance, height and speed readings. Other APP functions include a beginner mode which is on by default and keeps the drone within 30m until you are confortable. Great for beginners!

HolyStone thought of everything and its all in the box for you. If you have any issues the HolyStone customer support team will be there to see you thru.
