title: Wake up to, not too sure if it‚Äôs for beginners
text: Wake up to, not too sure if it‚Äôs for beginners

title: 2 days to delivery, 20 minutes to decipher: ...
text: 2 days to delivery, 20 minutes to decipher: a very user-friendly product even for myself as a second time flyer, and also durable/forgiving. You can't go wrong with this purchase, especially if you seek a solid, value-packed entry-level drone!

title: WOW
text: I love this drone. It is so awesome! It takes great shots. Very satisfied, would buy again. The battery is long lasting. Great!

title: What a cool toy that anyone can fly!
text: My husband's brother bought him the HS100 for his birthday after flying his brother's while on a trip to Florida. When it arrived from Amazon, my husband couldn't believe it! What a cool gift!  He was so excited to put the unit together and try it out. It took him about 20 minutes to assemble the blades and protectors out of the box and was ready to fly. Loading the HS GPS Pro app was easy. Sinking to the wi-fi was simple and communication was very easy. He had a little trouble sinking the GPS, but once that was orientated, the HS100 was ready to fly. He marked his controller with the left and right, up and down, forward and backward, turn left and right before he brought the unit outside to fly. He also hooked a lanyard, which he had from a convention, to the controller so he could keep it level in front of him. It was starting to become dusk, so viewing the lights from the unit and the battery was really cool looking. When he started the motors, our two dogs, a Shetland Sheepdog and Poodle/Terrier mix, came out of nowhere to view the sight too! Hovering first just a few feet off the ground, he controlled the unit straight up to what we guessed to be around 250 feet. Watching the pictures from the camera on the phone screen, we saw our neighborhood like we couldn't imagine What a cool toy! Thank you, Holy Stone

title: This drone is great üëç
text:
I love this drone. It is so easy to fly! The included memory card records lag free pics and video. While if you record to your phone there will be a little lag.
Thabk you Holy Stone for such a nice feature full drone for 200$ <3

title: Had to return - app disconnected shortly after takeoff
text:
This drone had an issue with maintaining the wireless connection where shortly after takeoff, my OnePlus 6T would lose connectivity with the wireless SSID broadcast by the drone and be unable to find it again until the drone's power was reset. It flew fine with the remote, but being unable to use the cool features of the app was definitely a dealbreaker.

I tried cleaning the contacts of the camera-body interface with alcohol and a swab - thinking maybe the detachable camera module was losing connection to the drone - but it did not help. I returned it for a refund instead of trying a replacement after I read that it had a hard time consistently connecting to Android, but works ok with the iPhone.

Very promising drone with great features and I expect that the issues I had were not universal, but it did not work for me.

title: Overall, satisfied.
text:
Overall, satisfied with the product. Customer service has been prompt when dealing with an issue with the drone. The drone dropped suddenly from about 15 ft and the propeller "cut" the guard off. Prop seemed fine, but the guard was cut in half.
Not sure if this is a persistent issue, but has happened twice now. Word of warning is to make sure that people, kids, and pets are away from the landing zone.

title: I would not recomend this Drone
text:
I purchased this drone and I can say it was ‚ÄúJunk‚Äù. I took the time to read the instructions and set it up perfectly. I had one successful flight until the batteries began to drain and I landed it. I charged the drone per the instructions and the next day I took it out in the early morning to get some good shots and videos.

I began to go through the set up and when I was done I noticed that the drone was flashing red lights.

So I went through it multiple times and then I look at mine iPhone and realized that the remote unit was not charged even though I charged it.

So, I took inside and charged it for 8 hrs. I was excited about going out and giving it another try.

But, as you can see in my screen shot that the remote was junk and wouldn‚Äôt charge. I wasn‚Äôt really sure how high quality this unit and the remote should be but it doesn‚Äôt appear to be very good quality.

title: Pretty fun and cool product; you won't be disappointed!
text: Followed the instructions which were a little confusing but once everything was turned on, the unit did its own pairing and setup.  We did the calibration pretty easily and the instant fly and land option is awesome. We snapped our first picture and it came out pretty good. Obviously, you can expect that there is a learning curve with flying a drone but using the controls lightly at first and you'll probably not have any accidents. It's pretty durable and comes with extra parts which is a thoughtful plus. The price is good considering what you get.

title: Hubby is happy!
text: Wanted to surprise the hubs without braking the bank. Mission accomplished! He takes very good care of his drone and it is holding up so far. The pictures he captures are very clear!

title: Easy to assemble and fun to use
text: Love having fun with our drone.  It is great for beginners like us.  Pretty easy to assemble and use.  Flew into a smaller tree first outing and the tree and drone survived.  Video capability is very good.

title: Would recommend for beginners
text: Once I obtained the proper sequence to operate from you tube I've been having a great time with it

title: what a great drone
text:
I bought this drone for my father, who is new to drones. One of my objectives was to get one not too complicated, but not too simple either.

I put it together immediately. The directions were well written and clear; although the instructions for putting on the rotating blades assumed you were replacing them! But it was easy to see past that.

Prep for takeoff involves calibrating it's internal compass and making sure it is connected with the GPS. Not hard. I found it best to turn on the aircraft first, and then the control panel. Next turn your iPhone on and connect to the Holystone wireless. Once that is accomplished the program on your iPhone will say 'ready for flight'.

Don't do your first flight indoors. The drone is a little intimidating at first and you need room to handle it. It will hover at about five feet and wait for instructions.

I realized quickly that when one instructed the drone to 'go forward', 'forward' meant the direction the camera was looking. Just something to remember.

The 'come land at home key' is handy but be sure you have a lot of room for error as it will not come right back to your feet.

The 760 p camera provides and excellent smooth video with great resolution. It is gimbeled so you can point it up and down, if you have enough coordination to do that while controlling flight!

Flying it at first was a challenge, at least for me. But I'm getting out and practicing when weather allows. Do keep your head about you and don't lose it!

title: Nothing
text: Sent it back A.S.A.P.

title: Okay drone for beginners. Don't expect too much.
text: Good drone for beginners. GPS and folllow me Moses are tricky and unstable. Drone goes crazy at times. Images are not stable so every time you move the cam in air. GPS singnla is Always weak no matter where you fly. One touch fly and land is a cool feature. Overall an okay drone.

title: Amazing drone !!!

title: Not Bad at All
text:
Pros : Crazy stable even in strong wind....Very controllable....cool features and decent battery life.
Cons : For me, unless I was on a golf course or wide open field the GPS wouldn't connect consistently. WiFi seemed to be effected by any surrounding obstructions. I would practice at my house and over it but the surrounding trees blocked the GPS even though the sky straight up is clear. I really liked it for the value and how well it flies but ended up returning it since the vast majority of my flying was in areas with surrounding trees.

title: Very easy to fly although we still need practice before we ...
text:
We purchased the HS100. We had issues connecting in the beginning because
of my phone. I had an LG Android phone and could not connect. We switched
phones and used a Samsung Android Tracfone and connected right away.
Support team (Andy) has been very helpful with this issue.
We have never flown a drone before and our first flight was last night. I
have to admit, we were a bit nervous about it, but when we got it in the
air it was incredible. Very easy to fly although we still need practice
before we take it out in public. We live out in the country and the views
were absolutely amazing. The clarity of the pictures and video are
outstanding. It was really cool to see our property from the air. We are
going to have many hours of fun with this thing!

title: little windy and no problem great pictures from park
text: Took out today for first flight, little windy and no problem great pictures from park, Video was decent but some jumping as its not a true Gimbal. Package came very well packed, did not care for the styrofoam, as some little pieces getting in around the prop motor. My Apple phone 7 plus does not fit the phone holder with the otterbox  case, just had to remove to make it fit. For the price not a bad drone.

title: New to Quadcopters
text:
I am new to quadcopters. I have looked at drones for some time now, and when I saw the Holy Stone HS100 on Amazon, I decided to give it a try, figuring I would crash and burn in no time flat. I'm 64 years old, so the fact that an old fart is trying to fly a drone for the first time, you can pretty much bet it's not going to go very well. It was even windy, gusts up to 10 MPH. Well these guys have built a very stable quadcopter with some real nice idiot-proof (old-age-proof) features. Once I figured out why the app was telling me the batteries were bad in the controller (I didn't pair the controller to the drone), the rest was a piece of cake! Calibrating the compass and all that good stuff! Then came the moment of proof. Pressed the launch button, and up it went, then hovered just below eye level. I played just enough to make sure it landed with the same button as it took off with, then I flew it a little way out and hit the Home button and it came right back to where it took off from and landed. Ohhhhhh, now I'm impressed. I played just a little more, trying to get it to go over to my neighbor's house when she and her children came home, but suddenly it would not listen to me and came right back home and landed. Battery was depleted.

Fast forward weeks later, and I am getting pretty good at flying this thing. I need to get better because my dog wants to eat it, and there are trees everywhere. But I have played with all of the features, running it out of touch with the controller, running the battery down, and simply pressing the return to home button, and the HS100 comes right back home and lands safely.

The only feature I have not tried is the Follow Me. I'll get around to that when I get my mountain bike back up and running.

So for a cool drone that's very reasonably priced and idiot and old age proof, this is a great buy!

title: Everything as described but I'll have a learning curve
text: Happy with purchase but I'll have to set aside a bit of time and wide open spaces to get the hang of this.  In all fairness, I never liked playing video games and all the controls remind me of that.  I wanted to be able to fly it right out of the box but there will be a learning curve.  I was able to get it connected to my phone and at least lift straight up and then back down.  The dog found the blades with his nose in the first 30 seconds of start up but both survived.  We held him back the rest of the practice session.  Will need many more practice sessions!

title: Very stable, easy to fly!
text: [[VIDEOID:5f43077b9e899e549c9507663d343b42]] CAUTION ‚Äì Holy Stone recommends the HS100 drone is for those at least 16 years old, and I agree. My purpose in this 1-minute video is to show how easy this drone is to fly. My 8-year-old great-granddaughter demonstrates how stable the GPS feature works, making the drone a pleasure to fly. My instructions to her were to ‚ÄúTake-off, fly straight out over the field, move it around some, bring it back, land it.‚Äù  This is just her second time flying the drone (1st flight was immediately before this flight). She is using only the joysticks. She is 8, I am 75 next month, and we enjoy sharing family time together, and flying the HS100.

title: Charge batteries as soon as you get it
text: Very advanced unit for the money.

title: Easy to fly
text: Easy to fly and learn to fly. Main complaint is my battery will not hold a charge after only using it a handful of times.

title: HS100 - new model February 2020
text: This model has a number of upgrades and improvements. The props are hinged in the middle; the battery has 3500 mAh vs. 2500; the controller is easier to hold; the case is held together with additional screws; and the 2K camera is changed from the 1080 model. I am a beginner and have had to learn and read much. Several things stand out from my experience:  Reading, UNDERSTANDING, and doing the instruction start-up routine is key.  Calibration should be done steadily, on a level surface. Don't fly in marginal weather conditions. Get and use one of the drone weather/condition apps. Fly in an absolutely open area. Don't try to go too high or too far until you get proficient. Use return to home as a last resort, and be ready for it to go up before moving to you. Stand in the same spot and pointed the same way with the controller - at least until you learn what happens if you move. This is an excellent drone to learn on, the pictures are great, and Customer Service if need is great too!

title: Great beginner drone
text: the only complaint I would have is that you will quickly outgrow this drone. It performs as it should and is great for learning. the RTH function is priceless.

title: Great for the money but definitely need spare batteries!

title: So Far So Good
text: This is my first drone so I‚Äôm still getting the hang of it. Charging and pairing were relatively simple. I did have a slight problem about 2 weeks after delivery. I contacted customer service and they responded immediately and it was discovered I was skipped one of the pairings steps. Only complaint is, it‚Äôs a little louder than I hoped it would be while flying.

title: AWESOME DRONE!!!!!
text: [[VIDEOID:1f32672d6040c3e61f925ac919d4bf6a]] I LOVE this drone! I own many drones (quadcopters) and this just became my favorite! It is so easy to fly for a beginner and a novice flier. You can adjust the flight distance from 30 meters to 400 meters. It comes set to 30 meters until you learn all the controls and everything this little gem can do. You can't go wrong. when you reach 30 meters it returns back to you. When you get the hang of everything set it how ever far and high you want it to go! It has a "follow me" feature that the drone follows you were ever you go. I have not tried that yet but I will when I get to some open space. It also has a "return home" feature. Just push the home button and the drone rises and comes back and lands right where you took off. I have used that and I was amazed how close it landed to me!!! I think that is the best thing about this. The scariest part of drone flying is losing orientation (which way the drone is facing) that's 99% of anyone losing a drone. No worries with this one! Just push the home button and it'll come back to you!! I got about 13 mins fly time but It was fighting winds and recording video and taking pictures.I highly recommend the HS-100. I have dealt with Holy-Stone and if you do have any questions or problems their customer service is great and will do whatever it is to make you a happy flier!

title: First I'd like to say that more experience drone users were very ...
text: This is my 1st drone.  I purchased it base on other reviews and some research from other I know that have drones.  First I'd like to say that more experience drone users were very impressed with the quality and features of the HS100. Similar drones would cost at least twice as much.  Secondly, being the 1st time drone user, I was completely taken by how easy it was to fly and land.  This is great for beginners like me who don't want to crash or lose the drone.  The auto take off, auto landing, and return home features are great.  Also, the camera app is easy to use with real time video is also amazing.  Finally, I have to say that their support group is also amazing.  I had a couple basic questions regarding its use since I am a beginner, and their customer service was great.  I would recommend the FS100 especially for Newbies.  The price, ease of use, features, and great customer support make this a 5 star product.  You won't be disappointed.

title: Easy to Setup and Fly; Reasonable Price;  Feature Packed
text:
I‚Äôve been in the RC flying Hobby for 40+ years. I have avoided Helicopters/Drones because they are notoriously known to be hard to setup, maintain and fly. The HS100 is an amazing EXCEPTION. Assembly, Setup and Flying is unbelievably EASY. The HS100 has many features that are in much more expensive drones. If you want to get into Helicopters and Drones this is the product to buy. The RTH (Return to Home) and Auto Takeoff and Land features get you into the air and back down on the ground very quickly, with little risk of crashing. The camera and SD Card worked better than I expected. The HS100 price is just right. Not too expensive for all the features you get and NOT so inexpensive that it is feature lacking. The HS100 is feature abundant!

Some Recommendations:
Read the instructions carefully and a number of times before doing anything.
Inventory the parts carefully before assembling the Drone.
(I couldn't find some washers which were stuck down deep inside the box which I finally found).
Make sure everything is fully charged, HS100, Transmitter and your Cell Phone.
Insure your WiFi is turned on in your cell phone.
You can fly the drone without a cell phone, but using one gives you a lots of extra status information so you get the HS100 flying quickly.

Install the propeller guards. Some people think they may not look that great. They work and it beats replacing props in the event of an oops.

A Good Routine:
Have a spotter with you on your first few flights.
Check and recheck everything before your first flight.
Make a Check List. The instruction manual has a very good first flight check list (Good Starting Point).
DON‚ÄôT fly if you see something wrong, FIX IT First!

Buy an extra battery. 12 minutes is about average flying time.
Some people complain that it's too short. Believe me, you have to concentrate on flying any RC model, 12 minutes is a long time.
After flying, take a break, think about what happened and what you want to improve on.
Take notes. Holy Stone provides a notebook (great idea). All good pilots use log books.
Recharge the batteries then fly again (Drone & Transmitter).
If you fly at a park with no power, you can get an inexpensive charger that runs off a 12v car outlet.

Wether you fly full size aircraft or models, the rule is check and recheck to minimize something not setup correctly, thus avoiding the chance of a crash.

When you are learning how to fly, the less distractions the better. Try to fly your first flight on a zero wind day (either early morning or in the evening when the wind is calm). The HS100 is very light, and very stable, so wind (if strong enough) can make the drone drift if you are not under GPS control.

Remember: The HS100 has the auto controls so you can take off and land with almost no experience.

However, if you want to start flying your drone far away and/or navigating around objects, you have to learn that the controls reverse as you change direction.

When the Drone is flying away from you: the Left control turns the drone Left; the Right control turns the drone Right; This is from your view point to the drone.
When the Drone is flying towards you Left control turns the drone to your Right, the Right control turns the drone to your Left. This is from your viewpoint to the drone.

A real good thing to do is find a friend that has an RC flight Simulator so you can get the hang of flying an RC model if you never have flown one before. Simulators are not necessary, but they can help you master the controls without having to think about it. The more instinctively you can control the drone the less chance of a crash. Some hobby shops now offer using a Simulator for a few hours at a time. The more you practice, the better you will get at flying. No magic here, just practice!

Once I got the hang of flying the HS100, I did a roof inspection on my house and my neighbors house which is a good use for Drones.

Sorry for being so long winded. I wish I had someone giving me some tips so I could have avoided some of my oops. I hope my review will get people excited about flying and help them get into flying the HS100. The HS100 is an EXCELLENT product and a heck of a lot of FUN to fly!

title: fun fun fun (revised)
text:
I purchased this Holy Stone HS100 for my first time drone piloting experience. I have flown helicopters since I was a kid and I decided to dip my toe into the drone world. Received the HS100 and proceeded to go through the setup. Setup was easy and I had no problem pairing the drone to the controller and my phone. Time to fly. The maiden flight was in my backyard which is fairly large and I was able to grasp the controls in a few minutes performing figure 8 maneuvers, landings, take offs, etc until I started to feel more comfortable with the controller and the drones reaction time. I was very impressed with how responsive the drone was in the air along with how stable it was. As with any un-manned aircraft wind is always a concern, so I did a test flight with the drone on a fairly windy day here in Atlanta and to my surprise the drone handled 10-15 MPH winds with no problem. Taking the drone to higher altitudes I was even more amazed at how well the drone performed. I have yet to lose control over the drone from interference, or flying away etc. I think the most impressive thing for me being a helicopter pilot is how you can get the drone at a desired altitude and basically take your hands off the controls and maneuver the drone to take video and pictures. I would never even think of doing that with a helicopter.. whole different world. Build quality: the HS100 is build rather solid and doe snot feel cheap in your hands. The controller for this particular drone is a little small for my hands and a little unbalanced when you have a large cell phone attached to it but not a show stopper. I quickly got used to the controller and it to has a decent build quality. The controls are intuitive and pretty much placed where they make sense so I did not have to continuously refer to the manual to understand what buttons and sticks did what. I have not crashed the drone yet but I think it would hold up fairly well in that case. Battery life was decent at about accurate to the advertised flying time. I don't think you can ever get enough battery life out of any drone as time does "fly" when having fun (pun intended). Price vs performance well I am no authority on that yet because as I stated this is my first experience with a drone, but for me it was well worth the price I paid, and I look forward to the fun I will have with this guy.

revision: So in the review above I stated that the drone was able to sustain decent flying in 10-15 mph winds. Well today is a windy day and after looking at the forecast we are having winds in the 15 MPH range so i wanted to test the HS100's capability. While the HS100 did hold its own I would not try to fly this particular drone in worst conditions than 15 MPH winds. I would suspect you will get even more of a battery drain due to constantly forcing the drone against the wind and or recovering from a gust. So just a FYI. One other thing I forgot to mention about the HS100 is the image quality from the camera. Not bad for a 1080P camera. Video was crisp and clear in the right lighting conditions and I would suggest as with any camera filming with the sun to the drones back for the best results. the Gimbal stabilizes the camera pretty good however on windy days some camera shake cannot be avoided. Other than that not bad at all. I recommend this drone especially for someone new to flying drones like me. However it does have enough features to satisfy the enthusiasts as well.

title: Great drone
text: The hs 100 is a great drone for someone who is a beginner. It is fairly easy to fly. The remote control is easier to use than your phone like other drones. It takes great video and pictures.

title: Easy to fly
text: This drone is very easy to fly. I bought this drone to practice flying and I feel like a pro. The controller is very easy to use and setup was a breeze. I only had a hard time with the propellers seen that the screws were in a lube but quickly fixed that by washing my fingers. Lastly, other than 720p video resolution, this drone is in line with the more professional such as DJI Phantom. I will definitely recommend this drone. It is worth the investment.

title: Seems like it will be fun.
text:
Had an issue with the controller and contact with customer service wasn't helpful.
However, we got a call back an hour later and was able to resolve the issue. There was an additional step that wasn't mentioned in the instructions and, once it was done, the drone and controller worked well.
It hasn't been flown enough to give a compete review, but at least customer service did come through.
Difficult beginning, but good resolution.

title: Disappointing gift!
text: I gave this to my boyfriend for Christmas. It was more than a little difficult to put together and get up and running!  We ended up having his sister get it going because she is a bit more techs by and it took her the better part of the day to get it going‚Äîwhich it did once and only once, then the controller battery died and will no longer hold a charge...  imagine giving someone a gift that doesn‚Äôt work well and then ‚Äúdies‚Äù!  The return window closed in January so we are hoping the manufacturer will help!

title: Great mid-range drone!
text: This is a very good beginner's drone. I know, I'm a beginner. I had a little trouble getting started with it, but I called support and they told me to take beginner mode off. Then it would fly far and fast! It takes great pictures and videos. The battery time is average, but batteries are pretty cheap so I bought a few of them. It's a nice beefy drone and seems like it would handle mistakes well, which it did when I landed it upside down. It comes with bunch of spare parts, and is easy to assemble (props are under the Styrofoam!) All in all, I am very happy with the purchase.

title: 100% recommended
text: Easy to use and super fun!!! Great videos and pictures :)

title: Not for beginners
text: Received it the other day.  Helpful customer service.  This is my first time trying drone so it is not easy for me as a beginner and take very long time to pair at my location. Aslo wifi is ver poor. Have a hard time using it

title: Never flew; "defects on circuit board"
text: Our drone never flew. We followed the instructions carefully and at the first 2 lift-offs the drone would drift rapidly back/left/down; if we were lucky we could catch it. Customer Service had me try different things and film the flight which resulted in the same thing and another crash. Then in trying to answer more questions for them the transmitter would not hold a charge; not even long enough to calibrate the drone. Then they answered with, "some defects on the drone's circuit board resulting the issues you currently have with it" and offered me a slight discount on a new drone. So the drone was defective out of the box and I'm not sure what the tests they asked me to do for them were to accomplish besides making the drone crash again.  The drone never flew and that should not be my problem - if you believe you make a good product with an occasional defect please replace it and not ask me to buy another. I just cannot bring myself to buy another from them with this experience. Maybe I'll put the drone and case up on eBay for someone who wants parts.

title: ... drone for me and it seems to be a good starter model
text:
First drone for me and it seems to be a good starter model. My son picked up how to fly it real fast. It calibrated quickly and easily, which I guess needs to be done every time we fly it. It always prompts us to rotate the drone to calibrate every time we power on. The video quality is pretty darn good. I'm sure it's good enough for the average hobbyist. It did struggle with 13 mph wind. Had to keep it flying real low and mostly with the wind. Like everyone else says, battery life stinks so you need at least 2 batteries.
I think it's hard to trust all of the 5 star reviews, since a free battery is offered for writing reviews. I seriously doubt the free battery is given for a poor review. Overall, I'm happy with it and feel that spending more money is for professionals only.

title: The Best Drone

title: At 70 Still a Kid

title: New to drones - let's see how this works out...(Update 5/11/18)
text:
New to the drone world, after only experiencing a small $20-$30 drone and practicing indoors. Obviously, this is a much more capable unit. My experience from one weekend of trial and error are as follows:

1) First indoor flight without reading the manual in depth - crashed into wall.
2) First outdoor flight - took off and pitched left, into the bushes.

Let's read the manual a bit more...
3) Followed the pre-flight checklist, paired with the phone, aquired GPS, and we can take off. Had about 3 basic flights roaming around which worked out well (ie - didn't crash into stuff)

A few issues I've had:
Synching/pairing can be a tedious process. Turn on the controller, turn on the drone, connect to wifi, wait for GPS, spin around in circles, calibarte (each time mind you) then you can start to fly.
However, I can not get this thing to stream video reliably to my Samsung S9+ - it'll catch a glimpse of something here and there, but fly by phone? Maybe mine's defective, I don't know - but definitely have not gotten it to stream reliably.
It is as stable as can be in wind - this isn't a $1k+ drone, so it is what it is. Controls are good, return to home and takeoff/land work well.

But - on the last flight, I used a combo of return to home and land - crashed it into the only chain link fence in the park and broke the rotor guard (thankfully I had it on!) - but with the spare parts I was able to swap that out fairly quickly.

Definitely need more than 1 battery as these take an eternity to charge when you want to use it.

Will update this review as needed for more real-world experience.
-----------------
UPDATE - 5/11/18

Since flying this drone a bit more, I've gathered a bit more experience with some tips and tricks about this drone.

First - take your time. This won't be something that you power on and fly in 10 seconds.

Here's my process:
Turn on the controller
Turn on the drone
Pair the drone (quick up and down on the left controller)
Go into the app to view the camera
Calibrate - spin around in a circle with the drone, tilt the drone so the camera points to the sky, do another turn, the set the drone down on a flat surface.
Enter the app, and wait until you have a good GPS signal. Personally, I've tried to fly without that signal, and its path isn't quite as predictable.

Once you're in the air, take it easy. Gentle movements. Doing this will lessen the herky-jerky movements of the drone.

I tried to stream video thru my Samsung S9+, but there seems to be a known issue with that at the moment. Thankfully I still have an old iPhone 6s+ that pairs just fine, and can stream video perfectly.

Customer service has been great and responsive - which these days can be hard to find.

Will continue to update as needed.

title: Great starter drone!
text:
This drone flies well and is easy to set up, easy to control. You can remote control it from further than I expected, and it can fly all right against a light wind. I wish the battery life were longer than 15 minutes for more explorative drone flying/footage capture, but it does fairly well with any practical usage for me.

Note: The return home function is great, but there's slight drift from the exact starting location, so be aware if you have a very small place you are taking off and landing at.

Thanks again holystone My husband is totally enjoying this drone !

title: High Quality Drone.  Good value for the price.
text: Very nice drone and easy to learn to operate.  One button takeoff and one button landing.  I have heard of some drones getting lost due to getting out of range and flying away.  You don't have to worry about that with this one.  It will return home if battery gets low or it gets out of range.  There is also a "follow me" feature.  I did a good bit of research before selecting this model and I have been pleased with it so far.  Video quality is very good.  I had a few questions about it so I contacted Holy Stone customer service.  They were very responsive and helpful. I was impressed with their patience and knowledge.

title: Very happy with my HS100
text: Awesome product well worth the money - lots of features, well built. Echo in the customer service department at Holy Stone is awesome. A pleasure to work with. Amazing to see the level of customer support provided after a sale.

title: GREAT drone Well Built perfect price!
text: This drone is the best drone I have ever owned.  I just received the HS100 on Tuesday and I am already in love with the performance, appearance, and over all looks of the drone.  Holy stone is a great company to work with and they're  very understanding.  I would recommend this drone to anyone and I would recommend this drone over the phantoms.  The camera takes very high quality pictures.  The only complaint I might have is the camera is sometimes slow to adjust to your phone and sometimes it might freeze for a short moment, otherwise it works great!!

title: OUTSTANDING DRONE (HS100)
text: I ordered this drone after much research!  When it arrived, I read the manual COMPLETELY and proceeded to assemble and set it up.  It was very easy to set up and calibrate.  I am an EXTREME NOVICE to drones, and it was very easy for me to get my maiden flight underway.  It is an exceptional drone for the beginner, and I look forward to utilizing it to its fullest potential.  For the price point, it is a great product.  My neighbor, who is an experienced drone pilot, said that the ease of use and quality of this drone, he is purchasing 2 for his family!  (he has 2 kids, 10 and 11 years.)  He also said he wishes that this drone was manufactured 8 years ago (when he originally got his drone.)  Customer service was very helpful also, by sending me web links for instructions and tips with this drone.  I only wish that it came with 2 batteries!  But, I will be getting another to increase my flight time!  Damn, it's fun!!!!

title: Cool drone for the money!
text:
I like this drone! Out of the box you must put the blades on it. This is not an easy task, because the screws and washers are very small. Prepare yourself with a pair of tweezers. Also, I found it to be very helpful to magnetize the included screw driver. Over all I am very pleased with this drone. The camera is not the best though, 720P. The app is very good and the GPS feature works well. I haven't had an opportunity to try the Follow Me feature yet due to bad weather in my area. I will update this review as I test out all of the features of this drone. The main reason I only gave 4 stars instead of 5 at this time is because I noticed a drift which came from nowhere. I was hovering it and it suddenly went it's own way. I was able to recover it easily since I was in Headless mode. Not sure why it did this. I was not using the app at the time. Just the remote. The only other reason I didn't give a 5 star rating is because of the camera. I think that if Holy Stone installed a better camera on this thing it would rank second to none! It flies well and is very responsive. I have also flown it with the app and the GPS brings it back home within 3 feet of where you calibrate it. This is a great feature, especially if the remote loses power or the battery on the drone gets low. It will fly back to the spot where you calibrated it. Again, I'll update this review as I try out other features.

UPDATE: This is one fantastic piece of work! I changed from 4 stars to 5, partly because of "user error" during my issue with the drone drifting off suddenly, and mostly because of the extreme customer service I have experienced since having purchased this and the HS200.
The follow me feature on this one works well. Also, I love the 3-D feature when using the app! I can fly the drone and let someone else wear the goggles and they have a wonderful experience! The other feature I love is how stable this thing is when there is a bit of wind. I have hovered it during a breeze and just watched it. If the breeze blows it, it auto compensates and stays in place.

Again, considering the cost, this drone is well worth every penny in my book. I think a camera upgrade is in the works as well. If so, I would give 6 stars if it were possible!

title: Great beginner Drone!!!
text:
I won this as a gift through my office Christmas party raffle who purchased it from Amazon and all I can say is WOW. I love this drone. Very easy to fly. Setup was a breeze and the directions were easy to understand and follow. Love the GPS function and the built in sd record, however the reader and card both "malfunctioned" when i tried to view it on my Windows 10 computer. not a big deal as i have others I can use and I think most companies wouldnt includes these items for free anyways. I did have some issues with the camera when trying to move it up and down with the remote as well, but i was able to fix it.

The app is easy to use and straight forward and quality is very nice. I have looked at drones in the past and never purchased one because there are just to many to choose from and i was afraid to waste my money on a crappy drone and wasnt willing to pay the money for a really nice one without having experience. This was a best case scenario for me and I'm really excited to have this drone and will likely recommend it to everyone starting out with drones.

Though it says 16+ and i wouldnt recommend young kids to fly it unsupervised, my 7 year old was able to fly it no problem. with dedicated landing, takeoff and fly home buttons its really simple for anyone to operate.

title: Great Drone, value for money for Beginners and intermediate users.
text: This is not a toy. This is a beginner drone for adults and older teens thinking of getting into the hobby, or for use in photography or videography. Great price, and value for money. It will take some wrecks and is fairly durable. This is a must if you are thinking of getting a more expensive DJI or other high end drone. Start with this one and learn to use it well before taking the next step.

title: Great Drone product for beginners learning to fly and control hdcam
text: I like this product a lot. Was able to take pictures at my Family reunion and all the kids thought it was the coolest thing ever and wanted to fly it of course (nope). The only thing I disliked was the battery life 30-45min full charge is all I'm able to fly the drone for. After the lo-battery life signals, you would have to charge it for up to +3hrs. However, sellers offer a FREE extra battery with review and feedback of the product and seller. So I guess having 2 charged batteries would increase the time I get to enjoy my Drone! I would definitely recommend this product to others looking for a drone that is easy to fly and use.

title: Great drone if you want to fly about ten times before it breaks.
text: I had the drone for about four months.  We flew it in total about ten times because you don't get very long on the battery.  Initially maybe did it like once a week for a few weeks then forgot about it for a while then a few months later again started playing with it and bought a second battery to get more fly time.  around the 10th flight the camera stopped moving.  which complicates flying.  When we called the company they said there is only a 90 day warranty.  So basically execpt this drone will fail in some way or another after 90 days and then become a paperweight.  When i inquired about a replacement camera they said sorry non in stock and none online.  Ok i get this is not a super expensive drone.  But i would think more than 10 flights.  And i would have expected you can get inventory when things break.  nope.

title: One-step closer to a professional drone and is good enough for exploring the sky view
text: [[VIDEOID:c794194d3b0415998014a09e0b914def]] I am not an experienced drone flyer, but take a look at the video I shot on the first flight, in a cloudy day. The drone is easy to maneuver, with good picture and video quality, stable app with clear pictures on app, large-letter instruction book, strong motor and blades, battery is so much better than the toy drones with dangling charging ports. I had many toy drones, none lasted more than 3 days of using, so I say this is the one closest to a real drone. Advice to persons new to flying drones, you need to familiarize and practice the controls at low altitude, practice in open space, be patient, this is not a toy so start slow. I wished they could supply two batteries, the charge takes 3-4 hours per battery, and the flying time is about 10 minutes.

title: Very good for aerial photography and videos
text: I was impressed by how well this drone operates.  Simple to learn.  Very clever electronics. It hovers in place very well, even in the wind. Because such tiny screws are used to attach the propellers, I assembled mine on on a bed sheet. One caveat: My cell phone could not be properly clamped in the control unit, as needed to position the drone for photos.  Instead, I used a heavy rubber band to attach the phone to the control unit, which works fine.  One reviewer complained about poor service, but my experience was otherwise.  I was getting "VPN interference" messages when I first attempted to connect the cellphone app to the drone.  I emailed HolyStone and got a prompt reply to shut off my phone's "MOBILE DATA" and "ROAMING" features.  Problem solved.  Also, be cautioned that the "Return Home" feature takes several seconds to begin, although it works great. Good aerial photos with a nice, loud "click" sound, and good videos.  I appreciate the relatively long (15-18 min) hover time.  I am very pleased with this purchase.

title: Quality build, steep learning curve.
text: Quality build, instructions could be a little clearer. Once you do figure it out the fun begins.  It isn't an out of the box and you're flying experience, expect to go through a couple of minute ritual every time you start it up. Once you master that it's easy to operate and we haven't even even advanced out of beginner mode but getting great use out of it

title: Good beginner drone at a good price.
text:
Seems to be a good beginner drone. I‚Äôve never flown one before but the instructions were pretty clear and the indicator lights were pretty helpful. I like that the lights also help tell front from back.

Picture quality didn‚Äôt seem great when I snapped a photo. The landing gear was in perfect focus but everything else was pretty blurry.

Hover wasn‚Äôt perfectly still, even though there was no wind. I was flying pretty low since it was my first time and it was connected to GPS. The drone seemed to drift around a bit and at one point it was doing circles after I pressed the ‚Äúland‚Äù button.

I have an iPhone XR Max, so it‚Äôs a big heavy phone. The phone mount on the controller seems a little flimsy, but it should hold it ok. For the price point, it‚Äôs about what I expect.

All in all, it seems like a good way to get into the hobby. I‚Äôll fly this around a bit and enjoy it until I‚Äôm ready for a higher end brand that has a better camera and possibly better flight capabilities.

title: HS-100, The Complete Package
text:
[[ASIN:B074YYVXQH Holy Stone GPS FPV RC Drone HS100 with Camera Live Video and GPS Return Home Quadcopter with Adjustable Wide-Angle 720P HD WIFI Camera- Follow Me, Altitude Hold, Intelligent Battery Long Control Range]]

This is my first Drone, and right out of the box, with minimal assembly and setup needed, this drone is ready to fly. And it's even preset to not fly away. In moderate wind this drone is stable and won't drift thanks to the GPS position hold and 9 axis gyro. Take it off beginner mode and the HS-100 flies high and has a huge range, almost out of sight distance (500 yards). The battery comes charged and ready to use, offering about 12-15 minutes of flight time. The camera takes really nice high quality wide-angle pictures and high-def video. A touch button "return home" feature makes returning to the original takeoff point and landing effortless. Using your phone, the available app allows for on screen control to takeoff, land, monitor battery levels, review flight stats, pictures, videos, and more. The HS-100 covers a lot of ground fast and the controls are very responsive to commands.

title: A great drone!  So easy to assemble and fly!
text:
I really wanted a drone to play with at my lake home. Always concerned about the cheaper ones being a poor quality and my lack of flying experience putting a good quality drone into the lake. Saw this Holy Stone drone on Amazon and based on the other reviews decided to purchase one.

What a great little drone! I had it assembled in minutes but waited until today to make my initial flight as I wanted my adult son to share in the fun when he came to town for a visit. Today was the day. Loved how easy it was to coordinate the GPS and fly the drone. The self takeoff and self landing button made it so very simple. Noticed that when it met the transmitter distance maximum, it brought itself back into our zone where we could control. Taking pictures was a snap and the quality? Well, I'll attach some pics so you can see for yourself.

So glad I made this purchase. Know it will get many hours of use.

title: I am having a lot of fun learning what can be done with this drone
text: I am having a lot of fun learning what can be done with this drone. I still have a lot to learn

title: This is a great product
text: I really love this drone! It flies higher than I initially expected and its pretty easy to maneuver. I had some initial confusion with getting it to fly but I called customer service (which was awesome! They answered write away and walked me through what I was doing wrong). After that, its been smooth flying! I would definitely recommend this product especially if you are just getting into operating drones. I love it!

title: Better than a selfie stick
text:
I asked for and received this for my birthday. I was excited and assembled it all that night but wasn't willing to fly the drone for the first time at night. Instead I setup a charging station for the battery, 2 extra batteries I got, and transmitter. I read that you need to be careful to use the cables that came with the drone so I used those 3 cables (1 with the drone and 2 with the extra batteries). After the first battery showed fully charged I switched it to the transmitter and left it on charge all night.

First thing in the morning I took the drone out and followed the setup directions. I had some trouble understanding the lights so I turned on the app and followed the on screen directions. Then I pressed the button to take off and ... nothing. I figured I did something wrong so I turned off the drone and transmitter then went through the process again.

Only this time the app said the transmitter battery was too low. I went through that process several times before giving up and going inside. I called support and found they wouldn't be open for 5 hours because they are on the opposite coast. I was really frustrated and considered just returning the whole thing but did some searches. Turns out a review here gives the answer.

When the app says the transmitter battery is too low and you know it is charged, just move the left control stick all the way up and all the way down.

So second time out I did all the calibration, moved the control stick, then it still wouldn't take off so I activated the gyro calibration again by moving the left control to 11 and right to 1. The lights flashed a few second and when I pressed the take off button it spun up and lifted into the air.

I think my surface when the gyro was calibrated wasn't perfectly horizontal because it was drifting a bit so I landed, picked a new spot and recalibrated the gyro and tried again. This time the drift was much better so I carefully tested the controls. Everything worked well and I walked it down the drive. I was very careful to stay back a few feet and make slow movements with the drone. We have a fair number of trees so the goal was to stay low and away.

At one point I think I got too low relative to the sloping yard and the wash confused the drone. All the sudden it banked hard into the yard and flipped over even though I wasn't touching the controls at the moment.

Fortunately the blades weren't damaged, just a little dirt. I recalibrated and tried again. This time I made a full circuit of the yard and sent the drone about 30' away, brought it back, took it from the basement walkout level to above the 2 story house, and made a transit above the house and back.

Then I started testing the auto landing feature starting low then higher and eventually above the house down to the walk out level.

Over all I'm really happy with how it performed. I took a few pictures and they are similar quality to my old iPhone5s. For the money I think this is a great starting drone. It's much easier to control than the mini drones I've had in the past.

One interesting benefit, when I walked along the drive the wash was strong enough to clear the few leaves that had fallen.

title: Worth the money, but buy extra batteries.
text:
[[VIDEOID:27b0880080008a7ad81d8ef38281f4bd]] So far, so good. I was debating between this and splurging on a Phantom 3 Advanced. This one had good reviews, and it was much less expensive. I'm still pretty new to flying, so I figured if I break one I would rather break a less expensive one. The GPS is super handy for maintaining a hover and flying in wind. The camera is very sufficient for my level of use. A full gimbal would be nice, but that comes with more expensive models. You get what you pay for. The controls are easy to learn, including the ones for pivoting the camera, managing recording and picture taking. I REALLY like the App. It is very cool to watch the camera feed while flying, and the status indicators on the app are much easier to see than the indicator lights on the controls. I did buy a two-pack of batteries, which was offered at a discount on Amazon at the time of purchase. The flight time goes by fast, especially if there is a little bit of wind and the motors have to work harder. A max of 15 minute flight time and a 3-6 hour recharge time for the batteries is kind of a bummer. I have a total of three batteries, so it isn't as bad of a wait. I also purchased the spare parts pack. So far, the only thing I have damaged are the rotor guards, but I suppose that is their purpose. Better to damage a guard than a rotor and motor.

So to summarize, I think it was worth the money. If you buy this, do yourself a favor and get at least one extra battery.

text: This drone is a great option for a low to mid-priced live streaming drone option.  I ordered this for my husband to 'play' with in our back yard and take to his shooting range to get up close views of his targets.  It works great for both purposes.  The image quality is excellent and with no drone flying experience he was up and flying within just a few minutes with no crashes!  Definitely recommend for a short-range, fun item.

title: The HS100 is a great drone for beginner.
text: Would be nice if the propeller guards just snapped in and stayed without the screws. I just can‚Äôt find a case that will hold the HS100 without taking off the guards and the screws are so small and can be easily lost.

title: More durable than expected
text: Ordered this drone to practice flying before considering purchasing a more advanced drone.  Out of the box, it was easy to add the blades and get things going.  Take off and landing is a breeze with the automated process.  Battery life is ok for what you pay for.  I haven't tested maximum range (you have to loosen up flight rules to get maximum range/altitude).  Camera synced up with my kids tablets and they found it fun.  If I was rating this based on the camera, I'd rate it 3 stars.  But I've had a couple of hard landings (pilot error) including an epic one.  In short, I crashed it 60 foot up in a tree and got it wedge in a crook in the branches.  I figured it was toast, as everything I tried failed to bring it down.  Eventually, we had a severe storm move through the area, and it fell (60 feet) during the storm.  The landing skid took a good hit and partially broke, but its still good enough for routine landings.  The camera got knocked loose from its mount, but snapped back into place and works like new.  And perhaps more impressively, since I didn't know it had come out of the tree during the storm, it survived 3.5 inches of rain.  I found it the next morning, took it inside, and let it dry for a couple of days.  Charge the battery, go through the preflight routine, and it fired right up.  I'm impressed.

title: Drone
